column5: Ran into a guy from our group yesterday and he said he ordered his license by phone in January thru the MNR..he said they gave him the option to buy a 3 yr license for $150 which he took...they told him he could use it an unlimited amount of times during the 3 yr period..I ordered my license on line in January and don't remember seeing this option..the reason I ask is that this guy is also the biggest BS'er in our group..but I cant see why he would make this up....anyone know anything about this?
He's not BS'ing you THIS time However that is the more restrictive "Conservation license".
ok..that makes sense..I hope he knows the difference..
Two things I noticed on the links: (1) prices have risen significantly and (2) no financial advantage to buy a 3 yr. license ... other than to lock in the current price for yrs.
It also looks like they "changed their mind)

The outdoors card is good for three years, why not have a three year license? You can tell the wife "I already have the card and license, I might as well go fishing!"One less thing to check off the Pre trip list!
Yes there is a 3 year sport license costs $239.64 or the 3 year conservation $148.18 plus the card $9.68

The license fee goes up a little each year. Does anyone know if they are planning a significant increase in license fees? If a big jump was in the forecast, I might buy a 3 year for the wife and I. But if only goes up about $5.00 a year like it has been, I just go with a one year.
Personally, I think a $5 jump is a big one. I can't imagine them increasing it more than 5-10% on any year.
